case_name: Kesavananda Bharati v. State of Kerala
summary: Landmark case that established the basic structure doctrine of the Constitution
key_points: Parliament cannot amend the basic structure of the Constitution
Fundamental rights are part of the basic structure
Judicial review is essential for democracy

case_name: Maneka Gandhi v. Union of India
summary: Expanded the scope of Article 21 to include procedural due process
key_points: Article 21 includes right to live with human dignity
Procedure established by law must be fair and reasonable
Expanded fundamental rights through judicial interpretation
